quadrants.title: Languages & Frameworks
quadrants.description: A selection of programming languages, alongside essential frameworks for building a variety of custom software.

quadrants.title: Methods & Patterns
quadrants.description: Key software development methods and design patterns, covering everything from continuous integration and testing to architecture.

quadrants.title: Platforms & Operations
quadrants.description: Technologies and tools for software and infrastructure operations, including platforms and services for managing and scaling applications.

quadrants.title: Tools
quadrants.description: A range of software tools, from simple productivity enhancers to comprehensive project solutions, catering to various project needs.

rings.title: Adopt
rings.description: Technologies we have high confidence in to serve our purpose, also in large scale. Technologies with a usage culture in our HMPPS Digital production environment, low risk and recommended to be widely used.

rings.title: Trial
rings.description: Technologies that we have seen work with success in project work to solve a real problem; first serious usage experience that confirm benefits and can uncover limitations. TRIAL technologies are slightly more risky; some engineers in our organisation walked this path and will share knowledge and experiences.

rings.title: Hold
rings.description: Technologies not recommended to be used for new projects. Technologies that we think are not (yet) worth to (further) invest in. HOLD technologies should not be used for new projects, but usually can be continued for existing projects.

rings.title: Reduce
rings.description: Technologies that actively want to be phased out and should not be used for new projects without solid reasoning. Technologies that we think are either out of date (legacy) or are not suited to the needs and capabilities of the team. REDUCE technologies should not be used for new projects, and should be phased out for existing projects.

labels.title: Technology Radar
labels.footer: The technology radar is a project by AOE GmbH. Feel free to build your own radar based on the open source project.
labels.notUpdated: This item was not updated in last three versions of the Radar. Should it have appeared in one of the more recent editions, there is a good chance it remains pertinent. However, if the item dates back further, its relevance may have diminished and our current evaluation could vary. Regrettably, our capacity to consistently revisit items from past Radar editions is limited.
labels.pageAbout: How to use AOE Technology Radar?
